bind.jr:constraintMsg: Check to make sure that these percentages total to 100%.
Check to make sure that these percentages total to 100%.
Check to make sure that these numbers equal the total amount of PHCs
Check to make sure that these numbers equal the total amount of PHCs
Check to make sure that these percentages total to 100%.
Check to make sure that these numbers equal the total amount of Clinics
Check to make sure that these numbers equal the total amount of Clinics
Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of Health Posts and Dispensaries.
Check to make sure that these percentages total to 100%.

input.label: HEALTH SURVEY
Data Entry Enumerator's Full Name

select1.label: Are there any missing pages from the survey?

input.label: Please describe pages and/or questions that are missing:
Field Enumerator's Full Name
Expert's Full Name
LGA
State
A1. Health Sector Respondents Present
Full Name
Position (including organizational affiliation)
Phone
Email
How many years has respondent worked in the health sector?
How long has the respondent been in their current position?
A2. Health Sector Respondents Not Present
input.hint: Refers to any members of the LGA office staff who work on the health sector, but who are not present on the day of the interview.

input.label: Full Name
Position
Phone
Email
A3. How long has the Director Primary Health Care (PHC) / PHC Coordinator been in the current LGA?
We would like to start by asking you some general questions about your LGA.
B1. What is the total population of your LGA?
B2. How many Wards are in the LGA?
B3. How many Villages/Towns are in the LGA?
input.hint: Please ask respondent panel for their best estimate.

input.label: B4. What percentage of the LGA would you say is rural?
input.hint: Rural refers to areas mostly consisting of villages and small towns only, often highly agricultural.

input.label: B5. What percentage of the LGA would you say is semi-urban?
input.hint: Semi-urban refers to areas that connect urban and rural areas, are not as sparsely populated as traditional rural areas, or are areas that cannot be cleanly classified as either rural or urban.

input.label: B6. What percentage of the LGA would you say is urban?
input.hint: Urban refers to areas mostly consisting of highly dense cities and larger towns. Check to make sure that these percentages total to 100%.

input.label: To start with, we will be asking several questions about different types of public health facilities in your LGA.
C1.1 How many PRIMARY HEALTH CENTRES [PHC] are in the LGA? *
input.hint: The * indicates that the response will be used later in the questionnaire.

input.label: C1.2 How many Wards have no PRIMARY HEALTH CENTRE?
C1.3 How many HEALTH CLINICS are in the LGA? **
input.hint: The ** indicates that the response will be used later in the questionnaire.

input.label: C1.4 How many Wards have no HEALTH CLINICS at all?
C1.5 What is the average number of HEALTH CLINICS per Ward in your LGA?
input.hint: The respondent panel should provide an estimated average here - no need to calculate.

input.label: C1.6 How many HEALTH POSTS and DISPENSARIES are in the LGA? ***
input.hint: The *** indicates that the response will be used later in the questionnaire.

input.label: C1.7 How many Villages/Towns have no health facility at all?
input.hint: Villages / town does not include hamlets.

input.label: We would now like to ask, based on your professional expert opinion, about how many additional facilities would be needed in your LGA in order for every household to be able to reach a health facility within 1 hour walking.
C2.1 In order to reach this goal, how many additional:
PRIMAY HEALTH CENTRES [PHCs] would be needed?
HEALTH CLINICS would be needed?
HEALTH POSTS would be needed?

In your opinion, in order for every household to have access, by walking or referral transport, to facilities capable of performing skilled delivery within 1 hour. Please take into account the geography, demography, and transport infrastructure in your consideration of how many additional facilities would be necessary.
C2.2 In order to reach this goal, how many additional:
HEALTH CLINICS would be needed?
PRIMAY HEALTH CENTRES [PHCs] would be needed?

select.label: C3.1 What are the primary barriers to accessing health care in your LGA? Pick the top three reasons.
select.hint: SELECT ONLY THE 3 MOST IMPORTANT RESPONSES. "Other" counts as one of the three.

item.label: Health care awareness and care-seeking behavior
People choose to go to private sector facilities

input.label: If other, please specify.
C4.1 How many General Hospitals are there in the LGA?
C4.2 How many Tertiary (Teaching Hospital and Federal Medical Centres) are there in the LGA?
C4.3 How many General Hospitals conduct Caesarean sections?
C4.4 How many anaesthetic nurses and doctors that can administer spinal or general anesthesia are in the LGA?
C4.5 How many public facilities have operating theaters that are currently not being used to conduct Caesearean sections?
C4.6 If any, why?
input.hint: Only ask this question and question C4.7 if there are operating theatres that are not currently being used to conduct Caesarean sections. Reasons can include equipment and recurrent needs, but could also include things like lack of personnel skilled in performing Caesarean sections, etc.

group.label: C4.7 Of the operating theaters that are not currently being used to conduct Caesarean sections, how many:

input.label: C4.7.1 lack equipment (i.e., surgical equipment, operating table)?
C4.7.2 lack recurrent needs, like medicines and supplies (i.e., suture, anesthetics)?

C4.8 In your professional opinion, in order to take a pregnant woman from any primary care facility to a public facility that can conduct caesarean section within 45 minutes, how many additional facilities would be necessary?

select.label: C5.1 What type(s) of vehicles are used for emergency transport in the LGA?

input.label: C5.2 Please specify other
C5.3 How many ambulances/emergency vehicles are in the LGA?
C5.4 How many drivers for these vehicles are in the LGA?
C5.5 How many Wards have no fully functional emergency transport vehicle?
input.hint: Fully functional: in routine use now and not requiring any significant repairs

input.label: C5.6 Of the wards with no functional emergency transport vehicle, how many have an existing vehicle that could be made functional with repairs?
C5.7 Of the ambulances/emergency transport vehicles in the LGA, how many/what percentage would you say have:
input.hint: Provide the option for the respondent to answer with either a number or a percentage, estimates acceptable.

input.label: most/all of the funding needed for routine maintenance?
some of the funding needed for routine maintenance?
very little/none of the funding needed for routine maintenance?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of vehicles or 100%

input.label: C5.8 Of the ambulances/emergency transport vehicles in the LGA, how many/what percentage would you say have:
input.hint: Provide the option for the respondent to answer with either a number or a percentage, estimates acceptable.

input.label: most/all of the funding needed for fuel?
some of the funding needed for fuel?
very little/none of the funding needed for fuel?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of vehicles or 100%

group.label: D) Status of Existing Health Facilities

input.label: The next set of questions apply only to the Primary Health Centres / PHCs in your LGA.
D1.1 Transfer and confirm the number of PHCs from Question C1.1, indicated by *.
D1.2 Of the Primary Health Centres / PHCs in your LGA, how many would you say require:
major renovation?
input.hint: Major renovation refers to situations where the building is not useable or not safe for patients.

input.label: minor renovation?
input.hint: Minor renovation refers to situations where the building is useable, but needs small-scale reconstruction or investment to be upgraded.

input.label: no renovation?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of PHCs.

input.label: D1.3 How many PHCs have:
adequate staff housing, requiring no further investment?
some staff housing, but require further investment?
no staff housing?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of PHCs

input.label: D1.4 Regarding the budget line needed for maintenance of power and water sources (i.e., generator, borehole) and for routine facilities maintenance (i.e., cleaning supplies, phone credit, etc.), what percentage of facilities have:
adequate funds in their budget line?
some, but inadequate, funds in their budget line?
very little/none of the necessary funds in their budget line?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to 100%

input.label: D1.5 Approximately what percentage of PHCs conduct deliveries?
D1.6 Approximately what percentage of PHCs offer family planning services?
D1.7 Approximately what percentage of PHCs use RDTs to diagnose malaria?
D1.8 Approximately what percentage of PHCs use ACT to treat malaria?
D1.9 Approximately what percentage of PHCs use antibiotics to treat pneumonia in children?
The next set of questions apply only to the Health Clinics in your LGA.
input.hint: Skip this section ONLY if there are zero Health Clinics existing in the LGA.

input.label: D2.1 Transfer and confirm the number of Clinics from Question C1.3, indicated by **.
D2.2 Of the Clinics in your LGA, how many would you say require:
major renovation?
input.hint: Major renovation refers to situations where the building is not useable or not safe for patients.

input.label: minor renovation?
input.hint: Minor renovation refers to situations where the building is useable, but needs small-scale reconstruction or investment to be upgraded.

input.label: no renovation?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of Clinics.

input.label: D2.3 Regarding the budget line needed for maintenance of power and water sources (i.e., generator, borehole) and for routine facilities maintenance (i.e., cleaning supplies, phone credit, etc.), what percentage of Clinics have:
adequate funds in their budget line?
some, but inadequate, funds in their budget line?
very little/none of the necessary funds in their budget line?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to 100%

input.label: D2.4 Approximately what percentage of Health Clinics conduct deliveries?
D2.5 Approximately what percentage of Health Clinics offer family planning services?
D2.6 Approximately what percentage of Health Clinics use RDTs to diagnose malaria?
D2.7 Approximately what percentage of Health Clinics use ACT to treat malaria?
D2.8 Approximately what percentage of Health Clinics use antibiotics to treat pneumonia in children?
The next set of questions apply only to the Health Posts and Dispensaries in your LGA.
input.hint: Skip this section ONLY if there are zero Health Posts and Dispensaries existing in the LGA.

input.label: D3.1 Transfer and confirm the number of Health Posts and Dispensaries from Question C1.6, indicated by ***.
D3.2 Of the Health Posts and Dispensaries in your LGA, how many would you say require:
major renovation?
input.hint: Major renovation refers to situations where the building is not useable or not safe for patients.

input.label: minor renovation?
input.hint: Minor renovation refers to situations where the building is useable, but needs small-scale reconstruction or investment to be upgraded.

input.label: no renovation?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to the total number of Health Posts and Dispensaries.

input.label: D3.3 Regarding the budget line needed for maintenance of power and water sources (i.e., generator, borehole) and for routine facilities maintenance (i.e., cleaning supplies, phone credit, etc.), what percentage of Health Posts or Dispensaries have:
adequate funds in their budget line?
some, but inadequate, funds in their budget line?
very little/none of the necessary funds in their budget line?
input.hint: Make sure that the responses add up to 100%

input.label: D3.4 Approximately what percentage of Health Posts and Dispensaries conduct deliveries?
D3.5 Approximately what percentage of Health Posts and Dispensaries offer family planning services?
D3.6 Approximately what percentage of Health Posts and Dispensaries use RDTs to diagnose malaria?
D3.7 Approximately what percentage of Health Posts and Dispensaries use ACT to treat malaria?
D3.8 Approximately what percentage of Health Posts and Dispensaries use antibiotics to treat pneumonia in children?

select1.label: E1 Are stockouts of essential medicines and consumables common in your LGA?
select1.hint: This refers to essential drugs being out of stock [OS].

select.label: E2 Do stockouts of medicines and consumables occur at health facilities in the LGA because of:

item.label: inadequate quantitites of necessary items within the LGA?
inadequate forecasting and management of supplies at the facility level?
inadequate logistics for the distribution of supplies in the LGA?

input.label: E3 If other, please specify.
E4 What additional transport provisions, not necessarily ambulances, are needed to support the distribution of medications and consumables:
input.hint: Response determined by the professional opinion of the respondent panel, no need to calculate.

input.label: from state stores to LGA warehouses?
input.hint: Confirm the response by reading back.

input.label: from LGA warehouses to facilities?
input.hint: Confirm the response by reading back.

input.label: F1.1 How many of each type of staff below are currently employed in the LGA?
input.hint: Official numbers preferred. Please ask the respondent panel to refer to lists/records of staff numbers if needed.

input.label: Medical Doctors/Officers
Nurses
Nurse-Midwives
CHOs
CHEWs
JCHEWs
Pharmacy Technicians
Environmental Health Officers
Medical Records Officers
Lab Technicians
Health Attendants/Assistants
F2.1 Approximately what percentage of current staff need in-service training on:
skilled delivery and basic emergency obstetric care?
neonatal resuscitation?
IMNCH?
input.hint: IMNCH: Integrated Maternal, Newborn and Child Health

input.label: antenatal care?
family planning?
malaria case management?
F2.2 What are the top four major topics on which the current staff require in-service training?

select1.label: F2.3 Is attitude of health workers a challenge to patients' attendance and quality of care?

input.label: F2.4 If yes, approximately what percentage of health workers need training in inter-personal communication?

select1.label: F3.1 Is staff absenteeism a major challenge in your LGA?

input.label: F3.2 What percentage of staff do you think is routinely absent from work?

select.label: F3.3 What are the major reasons for staff absenteeism?
select.hint: Select as many as are applicable.

input.label: F3.4 If other, please specify.
G1.1 How many LLINs were distributed in the last 12 months?
input.hint: LLIN: Long Lasting Insecticide-treated Net (bednet to prevent mosquito bites)

input.label: G1.2 What is the level of coverage with LLINs?
input.hint: Coverage with LLINs: % of nuclear families with at least two LLINs

input.label: G2.1 What was the % coverage of children under 1 who received measles vaccination in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G2.2 What was the % coverage of children under 1 who received DPT3 vaccination in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G2.3 How many measles vaccination campaigns were conducted in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

select1.label: G2.4 Does the LGA routinely provide adequate funding in a budget line for immunization campaign logistics?
select1.hint: Adequacy determined by the professional opinion of the respondent panel.

input.label: G3.1 How many MNCH week campaigns were conducted in the last 12 months?
input.hint: MNCH Week Campaigns include Vit A and Deworming distribution.

select1.label: G3.2 Does the LGA routinely provide adequate funding in a budget line for MNCH campaign logistics?
select1.hint: Adequacy determined by the professional opinion of the respondent panel.

input.label: G3.3 How many doses of Vitamin A were distributed in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G3.4 How many doses of mebendazole or albendazole were distributed in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

select1.label: G3.5 Is your LGA endemic for schistosomiasis?

input.label: G4.1 How many sites (health facilities and other centers) provide nutritional supplementation for malnourished children?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G4.2 How many health facilities provide inpatient treatment of severe malnutrition?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G4.3 How many children in your LGA received nutritional supplementation in the in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

input.label: G4.4 How many children in your LGA received inpatient treatment of severe malnutrition in the in the last 12 months?
input.hint: If possible, please refer to reports.

select1.label: G5.1 Do your facilities routinely provide iron and folic acid supplement for all pregnant women?
select1.hint: Provision of iron and folic acid supplementation to pregnant women is National Policy.

select1.label: G5.2 Is your LGA currently offering any incentives for women to deliver at health facilities?
select1.hint: Incentives can be in cash or in kind.

input.label: G5.3 If yes, please describe.
input.hint: Confirm response by reading back.

select.label: G6.1 Which types of family planning services are provided free for women?

select1.label: G6.2 Are you able to access supplies of family planning commodities that are free from national programs?
G6.3 Do you have a budget for logistics for providing free FP in the LGA?
select1.hint: Logistics may include: syringes, cotton wool, disinfectants, etc.

select1.label: G6.4 Do CHEWs provide injectable family planning?
select1.hint: It is a new National Policy that CHEWs can provide injectable family planning, which includes Depo Provera and Noresterat.

select1.label: G7.1 Is support for media, public awareness, health messaging, and public health promotion adequately funded, partially funded, or not funded at all?

input.label: G7.2 If not adequately funded, what would be needed?
input.hint: Confirm response by reading back.

input.label: G8 Assuming funds available for specific public information campaigns, what are your top four priority areas for public information campaigns that will address the major health challenges of your LGA in the next 12 months?
H1 What other issues hinder health system performance?
input.hint: Please write in list form. Based on the professional opinion of the respondent panel. Confirm response by reading back.

input.label: H2 Of all of the issues that we have discussed today, what are the TOP 4 MAIN challenges in your LGA's health system?
input.hint: List only the top four. Confirm response by reading back.
